text:
irm on admission whether the woman is really in
labour or not, and a period of observation is required to assess whether the contractions are regular and
persistent.
o It should in most cases be clear by 6 hours, whether or not the woman is in labour.
o For high-risk women such as those with a previous Caesarean delivery, this 6-hour period of observation
should be conducted in the labour ward, as long as there is a bed available
